results.title: I accuse = J'accuse
results.brief_description: Considered to be one of the most important anti-war films ever made, Abel Gance’s 1939 film is a remake of his original 1919 silent film. With the prospect of World War 2 imminent, gabel reconstructed his original to challenge the world. Jean Diaz is a research scientist who dedicates his life to ending war. When he discovers that his work is being exploited by the military, he summons up the ghosts of the war dead to make the world come to its senses.

results.title: Free Willy 2: the adventure home
results.creator_credit: Dwight Little, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler, Donner Productions and Shuler-Donner
results.brief_description: Jesse is reunited with his Orca friend Willy who has rejoined his family in the wild. Willy becomes trapped by an oil spill fire and Jesse is determined to rescue Willy even if it means risking his own life. Action packed adventure with superb photography, this is a film to be shared by all the family and lovers of whales.

results.title: The Secret adventures of Tom Thumb
results.creator_credit: Bolexbrothers, Hengemeth Panahi, Thierry Garrel, Colin Rose and Richard Hutchinson
results.brief_description: This post-industrial version of the famous fariytale is given a Kafkaesque feel. Employing pixillation techniques which combine human, model and plasticine forms, the directors create a unique visual style. Leading a bleak existence in a nightmare city, a poor childless couple is suddenly and bloodily blessed with a tiny boy. their joy is short-lived for the Ministry of Sinistry agents kidnap Tom and whisk him off to the laboratory of a thousand terrors, a centre of terrifying and sadistic experiments. In this netherworld of pain, Tom finds himself among bizarre creatures, part fur, feather, bane and flesh. To escape is fraught with danger, but to stay is fatal. Technically flawless in the evocation of its grim and apocalyptic world, this film fuses its many influences, from the Quay Brothers and Svankmajer, to the short films of Starewicz, into a superbly integrated and coherent vision of evil and innocence. WARNING: Not suitable for children as some scenes may disturb some viewers.

results.title: Wicked city (D)
results.creator_credit: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Makoto Sedani, Kenji Karada and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: The treaty between humans and demons which has existed for centuries is due for renewal. The treaty is needed to prevent the world from plunging into chaos and destruction. Terrorists from both sides use the opportunity to sabotage the agreement so that they may reign supreme.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Makoto Sedani, Kenji Karada and Manga Entertainment

results.title: The Whipping boy
results.creator_credit: Syd Macartney, Ellen Freyer and Gemini Films
results.brief_description: Based on the Newberry Award winning novella by Sid Fleichman, ‘The Whipping boy’ tells the story of spoiled Prince Horace and Jemmy a streetwise orpan who is `conscripted’ into becoming the Prince’s whipping boy; a stand-in for the the Prince when he is to be punished. When the Prince’s pranks, designed to get his father’s attention, bring the country to the brink of war, he and Jemmy escape into the wide world and a series of adventures destined to change their lives.

results.title: Hamburger hill
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Jim Carabatos, Marcia Nasatir, Interaccess, Nasitir-Carabatsos and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Set during the Vietnamese conflict in 1969, “Hamburger Hill” is a realistic, horrific dramatic depiction, almost documentary-like in format, of one of the bloodiest battles of the Vietnam War. The film follows the fortunes of 14 recruits through 10 days of hell as they make repeated assaults on a heavily fortified hill. The developing relationships between the young soldiers is tested by the grim realities of war and death. “Hamburger Hill” is a moving tribute to the men who fought a futile campaign which resulted in 70% of casualties.

results.title: Muriel's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jill Bilcock, P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Peter Szabo and Associates, Film Victoria and House and Moorhouse Films
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and out of place girl who would give anything to be like her bitchy friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bitter-sweet and much acclaimed film which touches the essence of the themes of self-respect, identity and friendship. Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: Gregory Ratoff, David O. Selznick and David O Selznick Productions
results.brief_description: A tragic but moving love story starring Ingrid Bergmann and Leslie Howard. The great concert violonist Holger Brandt is attracted to Anita Hoffman although he is happily married. He soon finds his love for Anita overwhelming and leaves his wife to tour Europe with her. But he cannot leave his past and his family ties behind and Anita sensing his dilemma, leaves him although it breaks her heart. Eventually Holgar and his wife are reunited as they share a personal tragedy. Sentimental, ‘Intermezzo’ is a great romantic classic.

results.title: Manhattan murder mystery
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Woody Allen, Diane Keaton, Anjelica Huston and Alan Alda star in this slick comedy about marriage and murder. The sudden death of their neighbour has Carol, (Keaton) convinced that a murder has taken place. Larry (Allen) her nervy publisher husband of 20 years wants to ignore it, their friend Ted, (Alda) is excited by the thrill of the chase, while Marcia, (Huston), a shrewd author joins Carol in an hilarious chain of events to solve the mystery.

results.title: Murder on the orient express
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Richard Goodwin, John Brabourne and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description:
Based on Agatha Christie’s famous novel, this Sidney Lumet Film has an all star cast. The legendary Belgian detective Hercule Poirot encounters a murder when he is aboard the famous Orient Express. The train is stuck in a snowdrift so the murderer is still on the train and Poirot must sort through a multitude of clues, lies and false trails before the truth can be revealed.
Cast includes: Albert Finney, Lauren Bacall, Martin Balsam, Ingrid Bergman, Jacqueline Bisset, Sean Connery, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller, Anthony Perkins, Vanessa Redgrave, Richard Widmark and Michael York.
